body:
Hi! We've received your issue and please be patient to get responded. ğŸ‰
The average response time is expected to be within one day for weekdays.

In the meanwhile, please make sure that **you have posted enough image to demo your request**. You may also check out the [API](http://echarts.apache.org/api.html) and [chart option](http://echarts.apache.org/option.html) to get the answer.

If you don't get helped for a long time (over a week) or have an urgent question to ask, you may also send an email to dev@echarts.apache.org. Please attach the issue link if it's a technical questions.

If you are interested in the project, you may also subscribe our [mail list](https://echarts.apache.org/en/maillist.html).

Have a nice day! ğŸµ

æ„Ÿè°¢åŠæ—¶å›å¤

It seems that you need to set yAxis data value, and it's length cannot be 0.
`data: ['']`

I'm not sure that data of yAixs is necessary for stack. Let me check.

For the time being, you can use this workaround to solve this problem.

It's not very clear what you expectedï¼May you can add `yAxis.data: ["Geschlossen","Neu","Zugewiesen"]` and hope this [example](https://www.echartsjs.com/examples/zh/editor.html?c=bar-y-category-stack) helps you!
@yufeng04 The example Kaljak provides was clearly wrong. Does yAixs.data is needed for stacked charts?
@susiwen8 Because the type of yAxis is `category`, the `yAixs.data` is needed.
@yufeng04 Thanks.
Do the `title.text` and `title.subtext` meet your needs?

@Ovilia I have simplified the demo, please head to this [demo](https://codesandbox.io/s/echart-legend-color-bug-8coso). here is a gif about this bug. 
![after1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9283889/70132303-e7fdf900-16be-11ea-87e9-997ba9a938aa.gif)

I have a similar requirement to custom the interval. In my business scenario, I need to statistics the product data by day. Usually, I think one day is 24 hours, so I set the interval as 24 hours, but in some areas(like the US), one day maybe 25 hours or 23 hours due to the Daylight  Saving Time. So I can't just set the interval as 24 hours. But there is no way for me to custom the interval.
